Text saved: We have more questions about how genes affect the brain and language. A gene is a part of your body that you get from your parents. It controls things like your hair color. Did a change in our genes give us the ability to speak? Researchers found a gene that changed between 100,000 and 200,000 years ago. This change seems to have a connection with speaking. It also seems connected to how our brains control our mouths and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but their gene did not change in this way. It is too early to say how much genes affect language. However, one day the answers might be found in our DNA.
